title: We Ranked the Best (and Worst) Actors to Play The Joker
text:
After a build-up that's felt like actual years, Joaquin Phoenix's take on The Joker, Batman's iconic arch-nemesis supervillain, will finally hit theaters this weekend (It's actually been a little over a year since director Todd Phillips shared the first image/screen test footage of Phoenix in character).

Obviously, Phoenix's take on the character—in this version, a stand-up comedian named Arthur Fleck—isn't the first. In fact, we've been seeing Joker portrayals for more than 50 years at this point, and as good as Phoenix's performance might be, both he and Phillips have continued to say that the movie is a one-off. So that means within the next few years, there will probably be yet another Joker, for Robert Pattinson's newly-cast Batman to face off against. Can't have a Batman without a Joker, right?

But for that being said, it's important for us to reflect on the various Jokers that we've seen through the years. Some, of course, are better than others. Where will Phoenix fall? We'll see once the dust settles. But for now, let's take a look at where the Jokers to this point fall.
